specific_learning_outcomes: Identify sites for soil improvement in the school or community
Construct organic waste pit for soil improvement
Demonstrate use of plant remains for soil improvement
suggested_learning_experiences: Discuss and identify sites in the school or community that have poor soil for crop growth
Construct a pit, a site or a structure for damping plant residue and suitable food remains and organic kitchen wastes in school
Plant crop in a residue pit to observe and appreciate soil improvement from accumulated organic wastes

Develop observation skills as they identify appropriate site, value of unity as they work to construct the pit and environmental awareness while recycling organic wastes in the pit method to improve the soil
key_inquiry_questions: How can we improve the soil using suitable organic wastes?
core_competencies: Critical thinking and problem solving: observation skills as learners identify appropriate sites for soil improvement
values: Unity: collaborative skills as learners construct organic waste pit for soil improvement
pcis: Environmental conservation as learners recycle organic wastes through the organic waste pit
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate the construction and use of organic waste pit to waste management skills learnt in science and technology

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify ways of conserving water for household gardening
Practice water conservation within the school or community
Appreciate importance of conserving water in the community
suggested_learning_experiences: Use devices or other resources to search for information on ways of water conservation such as mulching, cover cropping and shading in kitchen and backyard gardening
Make presentations to share experiences on importance of conserving water (mulching, cover cropping and shading) in kitchen and backyard gardening activities
Practice various ways of conserving water in farming (Mulching, shading, cover cropping) within the school
In groups learners to experiment on mulching (mulch some crops and leave others un-mulched and compare moisture conservation)
Develop learning to learn by engaging in self-driven task of water conservation, responsible use of devices to search for information and environmental awareness as they sustain available soil water
key_inquiry_questions: How can we conserve soil water in household gardening practices?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: learning independently as learners engage in self-driven tasks for water conservation
values: Integrity: taking personal responsibility in the use of digital devices while searching for information on water conservation
pcis: Environmental awareness as the learners conserve soil moisture through gardening practices
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate water conservation to knowledge on natural resources in the environment learnt in social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify ways of repelling wild animals to avoid damage of property
Repel wild animals to avoid destruction of property
Appreciate importance of living better with wild animals
suggested_learning_experiences: Watch video clips or listen to a resource person on safe ways of repelling wild animals (such as use of smoke, smells) to avoid damage on property (crops and domestic animals) and live better with wild animals
Innovate safe ways of repelling small wild animals (smoke, use of smell repellant or any other)

Develop critical thinking skills to solve the problem of destruction of property, demonstrating value of patriotism (love) for the environment by living better with wild animals and care for biodiversity
key_inquiry_questions: How can we repel wild animals to avoid destruction of property?
core_competencies: Critical thinking and problem solving: evaluation and decision making skill as learners explore ways of solving destruction of property by wild animals
values: Patriotism: learners show love for the environment by conserving animal diversity
pcis: Conservation of biodiversity as learners appreciate cultural heritage in their community
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate conservation of wild animals to conservation of natural resources learnt in social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify gardening practices for vegetables
Establish a nursery bed for vegetables
Grow vegetable crop after transplanting
Appreciate the importance of vegetables in provision healthy meals diet
suggested_learning_experiences: Brainstorm and share experiences on gardening practices of vegetables in a nursery bed
Prepare a nursery bed (container or ground nursery), sow vegetable seed and take care of the seedling
Make class presentations importance of growing vegetables as a source of food for animals and humans
Develop self-efficacy in producing their own vegetable foods, the value of social justice in sharing of tasks, and financial literacy skills by reducing daily vegetable purchases
key_inquiry_questions: How does growing vegetables contribute to food production?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: self-drive as learners undertake projects to grow vegetable crops
values: Social justice: learners foster fairness in sharing and undertaking of duties in the vegetable production project
pcis: Financial literacy as the learners appreciate saving on cost at school or family level by growing own vegetables
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate growing of vegetables to social economic activities in the community learnt through social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify uses of various domestic animals in food production
Relate various domestic animals to their uses
Appreciate the importance of domestic animals in food production
suggested_learning_experiences: Brainstorm and share experiences on the uses of domestic animals in food production (bees, rabbits, camels, fish, pigs, donkeys, dogs and cats)
Match domestic animals to their uses
Make class presentations on importance of domestic animals in food production while relating contributions of all the scoped animals
Develop communication skills as they present the uses of domestic animals, patriotism as they appreciate diversity of animals in the country, and appreciate importance of animals in food security
key_inquiry_questions: How are domestic animals important in food production?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: speaking clearly and effectively as learners make presentations on uses of domestic animals in food production
values: Patriotism: appreciating own culture by recognizing diversity of domestic animals reared in the country
pcis: Food and nutrition security as the learners appreciate the direct and indirect uses of domestic animals in food production
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate the rearing and uses of domestic animals as socio-economic activity learnt in social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Describe methods of preserving cereals and pulses the locality
Preserve cereals and pulses for food security
Appreciate the importance of preserving cereals and pulses for food security
suggested_learning_experiences: Brainstorm and share experiences on methods of preserving and storing cereals and pulses (such as sun drying, use of ashes, use of airtight containers) at household level
Preserve and store cereals and pulses using methods such as sun drying, use of ash and airtight containers
Make class presentations to share experiences on importance of preserving and storing cereals and pulses
Develop critical thinking skills to solve the problem of food spoilage, the value of unity and team work as learners make class presentations and food security awareness in preserving foods
key_inquiry_questions: How does preservation and storage of cereals and pulses enhance food security?
core_competencies: Critical thinking and problem solving: exploring ways of preserving and storing cereals and pulses to prevent spoilage
values: Unity: taking turns while undertaking tasks in preservation of cereals and pulses
pcis: Food and nutrition security as learners preserve available cereals and pulses to prevent food wastage and spoilage
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate skills in preservation of cereals and pulses to farming activities in the community learnt in social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Explain functions of food nutrients in the body
Categorize foods based on their major nutrients
Appreciate the importance of various nutrients in the body
suggested_learning_experiences: Search and share information on functions of food nutrients (carbohydrates, vitamins, proteins, fats)
Use real food materials, photographs, to categorize foods based on their major nutrients (protein rich foods, carbohydrates rich foods, vitamins and minerals rich foods)
Make class presentations on the importance of various nutrients in the body
Develop digital literacy as they search for information on nutrients, value of unity as they make presentations and health promotion as they learn about the importance of nutrients in the body
key_inquiry_questions: Why is the knowledge of food nutrients important in food production?
core_competencies: Digital literacy: interaction with digital technologies while searching for information on food nutrients
values: Unity: respect of each other's opinions while making presentations on importance of nutrients in the body
pcis: Health promotion as learners learn the importance of food nutrients in the body
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate food nutrients to prevention of non-communicable diseases learnt in science and technology

substrands.substrand_name: Dry Fat Frying and Deep Frying
specific_learning_outcomes: Describe dry fat frying and deep frying as methods of cooking
Cook food using dry fat frying and deep frying methods
Embrace dry fat frying and deep frying in food production
suggested_learning_experiences: Watch video clip or demonstration on dry fat frying and deep frying methods of cooking
Cook and serve dry fried and deep fried foods

Develop learning to learn while working cautiously to dry frying and deep frying processes, working resiliently while following cooking steps, promoting safety measures while working with fire and fats
key_inquiry_questions: How can we cook foods using dry fat frying and deep frying methods?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: self-discipline as learners work cautiously to fry foods
values: Responsibility: observing safety as learners handle hot fats and equipment in frying foods
pcis: Safety and security for self and others as learners handle hot equipment and fat while frying food
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate safety and first aid from burns and scald to knowledge learnt in science and technology

specific_learning_outcomes: Describe good grooming as a daily health habit
Practice good grooming as a daily health habit
Appreciate good grooming as a healthy habit
suggested_learning_experiences: Discuss and share experiences on aspects of good grooming such dressing for different occasions
Demonstrate different ways of dressing and etiquette for different activities
Adopt good grooming while carrying out daily chores
Develop self-confidence while promoting good grooming, respect (open mindedness) in appreciating others and personal hygiene to promote preventive health
key_inquiry_questions: How does good grooming promote personal hygiene?
core_competencies: Self-efficacy: identification of self as learners develop good grooming habits
values: Respect: positive regard for self and others as learners adopt good grooming habit
pcis: Health promotion as learners adopt preventive health practices through good grooming habits
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate good grooming habits to self-discovery learnt in social studies

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify surfaces made from different materials in home environment
Clean different types of surfaces in the home environment
Appreciate living in a clean home environment to promote healthy living
suggested_learning_experiences: Discuss and share experiences on surfaces made from different materials such as glass, wooden, earthen floors, cemented and tiled
Clean different types of surfaces such as glass, wooden, earthen floors, cemented and tiled
Develop listening and speaking skills while brainstorming, unity while cleaning surfaces and safety while they take personal care in the cleaning activity
key_inquiry_questions: How do you clean surfaces made from different materials?
core_competencies: Communication and collaboration: listening and speaking skills using facts to support opinions in brainstorming on home hygiene
values: Unity: taking turns in activities while learners participate in cleaning surfaces
pcis: Safety of self and others while learners clean surfaces at home
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate cleaning of surfaces to prevention of contamination and prevention of spreading communicable diseases learnt in science and technology

specific_learning_outcomes: Describe how to launder a cotton item
Launder a cotton item for personal hygiene
Appreciate importance of laundry work for hygiene purposes
suggested_learning_experiences: Watch a clip or observe a demonstration on how to launder a cotton item (white and fast coloured cotton)
Launder a white and fast coloured cotton item
Practice laundering of white and fast coloured items at home to appreciate the importance of laundry work for personal hygiene
Develop learning to learn as they adopt learnt skills to launder personal items, responsibility while taking care of the personal items and hygiene promotion by maintaining cleanliness
key_inquiry_questions: How does laundering cotton items promote hygiene?
core_competencies: Learning to learn: sharing of ideas when carrying out activities with peers in laundering cotton items
values: Responsibility: taking care of personal items in the laundering of cotton items
pcis: Personal hygiene as they clean cotton items to promote health
links_to_other_subjects: Learners relate personal hygiene to communicable diseases learnt in science and technology

specific_learning_outcomes: Identify stitches used in repairing garments
Make samples of stitches used to repair garments
Use the stitches to repair gapping seam
Adopt the stitches to repair of garments
suggested_learning_experiences: Use pictures, realia, video clips and charts to identify stitches such as back stitch and running stitch used in repairing garment
Make samples of running and back stitch
Use back stitch and running stitch to repair gapping seam
Adopt the stitches to repair their daily wear
Develop problem solving skills as they repair their garments
Practice responsibility as learners take care of their clothes
Develop financial literacy as learners save costs of repairs
key_inquiry_questions: What stitches are used for repairing clothes?
How can we save money by repairing our own garments?
core_competencies: Critical thinking and problem solving: evaluation and decision making skills as learners explore ways of repairing garment
values: Responsibility: taking care of personal items through repairing of worn out parts
pcis: Financial literacy as learners save costs by repairing own clothes
links_to_other_subjects: Creative Arts: cloth repairing skills such as use of colours relate to choice of colours learnt for aesthetic purposes

specific_learning_outcomes: Distinguish between horizontal and vertical innovative gardening
Construct vertical and horizontal gardens for growing crop
Adopt the use of vertical and horizontal gardens in growing crops
suggested_learning_experiences: Watch or observe stimulus materials (video clips, pictures, and photographs) on innovative gardening practices showing various crops in innovative gardens (vertical and horizontal gardens)
Use sacks, plastic bottles, walls, plastic pipes among others to construct vertical and horizontal gardens for growing crops
Use the vertical and horizontal gardens to grow appropriate crop
Develop creativity and innovation skills as learners design and construct the gardens
Practice team work as the learners construct the gardens
Develop problem solving skills as learners solve pertinent problem of space for growing crops
key_inquiry_questions: How can gardening be done on vertical and horizontal spaces?
What materials can we use to construct innovative gardens?
How can we solve the problem of limited space for growing crops?
core_competencies: Creativity and imagination: designing and assembling skills as learners innovate vertical and horizontal gardens
values: Unity: team spirit as learners take turns in constructing vertical and horizontal garden
pcis: Environmental awareness as learners learn how to utilize limited spaces through use of vertical and horizontal gardens
links_to_other_subjects: Creative Arts: designing structures and use of craft tools relate to skills learnt in creative arts
